The corpus provides insights into the theories surrounding general intelligence and narrow AI, with a focus on machine intelligence. 1. Definitions of human intelligence:
   - (2007) [1] The paper discusses various informal definitions of human intelligence provided by experts, setting the foundation for defining machine intelligence. However, it does not specify any particular definition. 2. Measuring Intelligence:
   - (2007) [1] The authors emphasize the need to establish the fundamentals of intelligence measurement applicable to various systems, recognizing the difficulty in developing a general notion of intelligence for machines. - (2024) [2] The Turing Test is presented as a widely recognized method for evaluating machine intelligence, with passing the test indicating an intelligent machine. 3. Formalization of Intelligence:
   - (2007) [1] The authors propose mathematically formalizing essential features from well-known definitions of human intelligence to create a general measure of machine intelligence. They believe this equation captures the concept of machine intelligence in the broadest reasonable sense. 4. Relation between Universal Intelligence and Human Intelligence:
